Package de.dixti.jarscan

With the classes in this package you can use JarScan programmatically.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Printer Interface for printing JarResults used by JarScan.
Scanner A Scanner implementation is used by JarScan for a certain scan option.
 

Class Summary
FileStream A FileStream is a common interface for a simple file or for a file that in nested in an archive.
Jar This class offers one API for JarFile and JarInputStream.
JarScan JarScan is the central class for scanning archives.
Main This is the Main-Class for using jarscan from the commandLine.
Options Options contains all Options of JarScan.
Result A Result is a tree of Results.
 

Exception Summary
JarScanException Thrown if any Exception occurs while initializing or scanning.
 

Package de.dixti.jarscan Description

With the classes in this package you can use JarScan programmatically. With JarScan you can set all the flags that you know from using jarscan as a command line tool. JarScan.scan() starts the scanning. It returns the results of scanning as a Result. E.g. you can use the result to print it. There is also another way to do this. You can set your own printer with JarScan.setPrinter(Printer). Then jarscan will call your Printer every time after scanning an archive. See the online tutorial for more information:
